item.content:encoded: WH photo of Pres Obama & Ruby Bridges & Norman Rockwell painting of her escort into an all-white school in 1960. http://bit.ly/njOJ1X President Barack Obama, Ruby Bridges, and representatives of the Norman Rockwell Museum view Rockwell’s "The Problem We All Live With," hanging in a West Wing hallway near the Oval Office, July 15, 2011. Bridges is the girl portrayed in the painting. (Official White House Photo by Pete Souza) This official White House photograph is being made available only for publication by news organizations and/or for personal use printing by the subject(s) of the photograph. The photograph may not be manipulated in any way and may not be used in commercial or political materials, advertisements, emails, products, promotions that in any way suggests approval or endorsement of the President, the First Family, or the White House. item.title: "Very bold or very dumb": data caps don't apply to ISP's own movie service
item.description: http://j.mp/ortHzL This is literally the situation that net neutrality advocates warned would happen without regulatory intervention.
item.content:encoded: http://j.mp/ortHzL This is literally the situation that net neutrality advocates warned would happen without regulatory intervention. Major Canadian ISP Shaw Communications has rolled out a plan to offer unlimited movies to TV, computers, and smartphones for CA$12 a month—oh, and the data won't count to your monthly bit cap (but Netflix streaming will). Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: arstechnica.com

item.title: Getty Images Says Google Plus Terms of Service is "OK"
item.description: Getty Images Says Google Plus Terms of Service is "OK" http://rww.to/nxQ2DX
item.content:encoded: Getty Images Says Google Plus Terms of Service is "OK" http://rww.to/nxQ2DX Should photographers be concerned about Google Plus? This is the subject on an ongoing debate right now, due to the wording Google uses in its Terms of Service - specifically parts that seem to indicate it will have rights to photos posted on the new social network. But some folks, including both professional photographers and an intellectual property attorney say the reaction is overblown. The issue is not a "Google" problem - it's something to consider before posting your images online, anywhere on the Web. This week, the lawyers at stock photography leader Getty Images have decided to weigh in... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.content:encoded: California governor signs bill requiring schools to teach gay history http://rss.cnn.com/~r/rss/cnn_latest/~3/saUse_YkUMI/index.html Democratic California Gov. Jerry Brown said Thursday he had signed a bill that will require public schools in the state to teach students about the contributions of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Americas. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: cnn.com
